name: Bruce Schneier
background: Cryptographer, security technologist, author. Created Blowfish cipher. Writes influential 'Schneier on Security' blog. Focuses on security as systems problem, not just technical one.

principles.name: Attack trees reveal vulnerabilities
principles.description: Model attacks as trees with goals at root and methods as branches. Systematic threat modeling finds weaknesses intuition misses. Think like an attacker to defend effectively.
principles.falsification: When attackers use unexpected methods not captured in pre-built attack trees

principles.name: Security is a process, not a product
principles.description: You can't buy security - you maintain it. Security requires continuous monitoring, updating, and adapting. Products help but process determines outcomes.
principles.falsification: When a security product genuinely provides strong guarantees with minimal operational burden

principles.name: Security theater versus actual security
principles.description: Many security measures make us feel safer without making us safer. Distinguish real risk reduction from visible but ineffective countermeasures. Measure actual impact, not perceived impact.
principles.falsification: When perceived security genuinely deters attacks even without technical effectiveness
